definition: Cihai, an encyclopedic dictionary first published in 1915, and frequently revised
old variant of 辭|辞[ci2]
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
surname Hai

sentences.english: Marriage certificate just, need to make like "citing" so thick?
sentences.chinese: 结婚证而已，需要搞得像《辞海》这样厚吗？

sentences.english: Both Cihai and Ciyuan are large-scale Chinese dictionaries.
sentences.chinese: 《辞海》和《辞源》都是大型的汉语词典。

sentences.english: Various editions of Cihai have made record sales.
sentences.chinese: 历版《辞海》都曾创下销售奇迹。

sentences.english: So we draft up things like dictionaries, thesauruses, and style books.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我们起草那字典，辞海和语法书。

definition: Hanyu Da Cidian, the largest Chinese dictionary, with over 375,000 word entries, first published 1986-1994
dictionary/encyclopedia
the Kangxi Dictionary, named after the Kangxi Emperor, who in 1710 ordered its compilation, containing 47,035 single-character entries
dictionary/also written 詞典|词典[ci2 dian3]/CL:本[ben3],部[bu4]
Hanyu Da Zidian, one of the most comprehensive Chinese character dictionaries with 54,678 (and later 60,370) entries, first published between 1986-1990
dictionary/also written 辭典|辞典[ci2 dian3]/CL:部[bu4],本[ben3]
Shuowen Jiezi, the original Han dynasty Chinese character dictionary with 10,516 entries, authored by Xu Shen 許慎|许慎[Xu3 Shen4] in 2nd century
Chinese character dictionary (containing entries for single characters, contrasted with a 詞典|词典[ci2 dian3], which has entries for words of one or more characters)/(coll.) dictionary/CL:本[ben3]
compact edition (of a dictionary etc)
reference book (such as dictionary, almanac, gazetteer etc)
revised edition (of a book)
character book (i.e. school primer)
rime dictionary (ancient type of Chinese dictionary that collates characters by tone and rhyme rather than by radical)
the Twenty-Four Histories (25 or 26 in modern editions), collection of books on Chinese dynastic history from 3000 BC till 17th century/fig. a long and complicated story
twenty four dynastic histories (or 25 or 26 in modern editions)
Records of the Grand Historian, by 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1], first of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3]
